Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.ui.gui

Class GraphicalUserInterface

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.view.ui.gui.GraphicalUserInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserInterface, Runnable
public class GraphicalUserInterface extends javafx.application.Application implements UserInterface, Runnable
GraphicalUserInterface allows to present the game's information and to catch the player's input through a javafx-based GUI application

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Method launched when the javafx application is run. Sets up the stage and notifies the Client that the user interface is ready.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - default stage

    • resetError

      public void resetError()
      resetError does nothing in the GUI. GUI reports errors through pop-up Therefore, there's no need to reset.
      Specified by:
      resetError in interface UserInterface

    • setGameStatus

      public void setGameStatus(GameStatus gameStatus, TurnStatus turnStatus, String playerTurn)
      GUI doesn't need the game status to be internally stored. This method does nothing.
      Specified by:
      setGameStatus in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      gameStatus - current GameStatus phase
      turnStatus - current TurnStatus (PLACE/DRAW)
      playerTurn - the nickname of the player that needs to play

    • setDrawScene

      public void setDrawScene()
      This method does nothing, since GUI doesn't support a scene dedicated to the draw/pick up. GUI merges the board and draw GUI scene in a single GUI scene.
      Specified by:
      setDrawScene in interface UserInterface

    • setPlayerBoardScene

      public void setPlayerBoardScene(Player player)
      Displays the board of the local player (also the drawable cards). The parameter is ignored since switching to another player's board is an operation handled internally by the controller.
      Specified by:
      setPlayerBoardScene in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      player - ignored.

    • setChatScene

      public void setChatScene(Player player)
      Unsupported operation, since the GUI doesn't support a scene dedicated to the Chat alone
      Specified by:
      setChatScene in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      player - ignored
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - in any case

    • setScoreScene

      public void setScoreScene()
      Displays the scoreboard as a secondary window

      public void update()
      Allows view to request the GUI to be updated. It forward the update request to the currently displayed scene's controller

    • reportError

      public void reportError(RuntimeException exception)
      Allows to display an error through the GUI. It forward the report request to the currently displayed scene's controller
      Specified by:
      reportError in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
